intro: Gynoxys cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' gynoxys, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed edges, and it produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
